meanings.definition: The quality or state of being capable of being remedied.
meanings.sent1: Her remediabilities allowed her to fix any mistake she made.
meanings.sent2: The remediabilities of the situation were evident, giving hope for a solution.
meanings.sent3: His remediabilities were put to the test when he tried to repair the broken toy.
meanings.sent4: The remediabilities of the plan shone through, offering a path to success.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's remediabilities made learning from errors a positive experience.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something can be corrected or improved.
meanings.sent1: The remediabilities of the software allowed for easy updates.
meanings.sent2: We assessed the remediabilities of the project to determine its potential for enhancement.
meanings.sent3: The remediabilities of the recipe were tested when she added too much salt.
meanings.sent4: His creativity had endless remediabilities, making him a valuable team member.
meanings.sent5: The remediabilities of the garden design were endless, offering room for growth and change.
